name: Enable encryption at rest for DynamoDB tables using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMK)
description: Ensure that all DynamoDB tables are encrypted at rest using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMK) for enhanced security and control over encryption keys.

name: Enable Point-in-Time Recovery (PITR) for DynamoDB tables
description: Enable Point-in-Time Recovery (PITR) for all DynamoDB tables to allow continuous backups of table data and provide the ability to restore to any point in time within the last 35 days.

name: Enable deletion protection for DynamoDB tables
description: Enable deletion protection for all DynamoDB tables to prevent accidental deletion during regular table management operations.

name: Enable encryption at rest for DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMK)
description: Ensure that all DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters are encrypted at rest using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMK) for enhanced security and control over encryption keys.

name: Enable encryption in transit for DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters
description: Ensure that all DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters have encryption in transit enabled, with the endpoint encryption type set to TLS, to protect data during transmission.

name: Deploy DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters across multiple Availability Zones
description: Deploy DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters across multiple Availability Zones to enhance availability and fault tolerance of the caching layer.

name: Include DynamoDB tables in AWS Backup plans
description: Ensure that all DynamoDB tables are included in AWS Backup plans to provide an additional layer of protection and enable cross-region backup capabilities.

name: Restrict DynamoDB table access to specific AWS accounts or IAM principals
description: Implement IAM policies that restrict access to DynamoDB tables to only specified AWS accounts or IAM principals, following the principle of least privilege.

name: Enable auto-scaling for DynamoDB tables
description: Configure DynamoDB tables to automatically scale read and write capacity as needed, either using on-demand capacity mode or provisioned mode with auto-scaling, to ensure optimal performance and cost efficiency.

name: Enable encryption at rest for DynamoDB global table replicas using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMK)
description: Ensure that all DynamoDB global table replicas are encrypted at rest using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMK) for enhanced security and control over encryption keys.

name: Enable VPC endpoints for DynamoDB
description: Configure VPC endpoints for DynamoDB to enable private connectivity between your VPC and DynamoDB, without requiring an internet gateway, NAT device, VPN connection, or AWS Direct Connect connection.

name: Implement fine-grained access control for DynamoDB tables
description: Use IAM policies with conditions to implement fine-grained access control for DynamoDB tables, limiting access to specific items and attributes based on user identity or other contextual information.

name: Enable DynamoDB Streams for critical tables
description: Enable DynamoDB Streams for critical tables to capture item-level modifications and trigger real-time processing or replication of data changes.

name: Implement DynamoDB table tagging strategy
description: Implement a consistent tagging strategy for DynamoDB tables to facilitate resource management, cost allocation, and access control based on tags.

name: Configure DynamoDB Time to Live (TTL) for applicable tables
description: Enable and configure DynamoDB Time to Live (TTL) for tables that contain time-sensitive data to automatically delete expired items and reduce storage costs.
